On the Wednesday edition of Breitbart News Daily, broadcast live on SiriusXM Patriot Channel 125 from 6AM to 9AM EST, host and Breitbart News Executive Chairman Stephen K. Bannon will discuss the state of the political debate

Veteran conservative marketing strategist Matthew Palumbo will co-host in studio with Bannon.

We’ll also hear from former Speaker of the House Newt Gingrich, who will discuss the Paul Ryan controversy as well as his new report on “2016 Election Principles.”

Andrew McCarthy, former Assistant U.S. Attorney and senior fellow at National Review, will discuss El Chapo being brought to justice.

SiriusXM Vice President for news and talk Dave Gorab called the show “the conservative news show of record.”

Follow Breitbart News on Twitter for live updates during the show.
Andrea Tantaros, Fox News Contributor and co-host of The Five, will discuss her new book Tied Up in Knots: How Getting What We Wanted Made Women Miserable.
Special guests include Duck Commander Phil Robertson, who will discuss his epic new film “Torchbearer” screening next week at the Cannes film festival.
Live from London, Rome, and Jerusalem, Breitbart correspondents will provide updates on the latest international news.
Frank Gaffney, the President of the Center for Security Policy, will discuss the latest in the foreign policy debate.
Breitbart News Daily is the first live conservative radio enterprise to air seven days a week.
Wisconsin Congressman Sean Duffy will discuss the need to unify the GOP.
Listeners may call into the show at: 866-957-2874.
